abstract: Rules issued by Colorado's Division of Private Occupational Schools, which require certification for programs that train yoga teachers, spur debate over such regulation; yoga teacher training schools have increased nearly 20 percent, and officials say unregulated occupational schools leave aspiring teachers vulnerable to fraud.
lead_paragraph: A debate that has roiled Colorado’s growing yoga world pits studio owners against a state agency that says programs to train yoga teachers must be certified.

headline.main: Colorado Yogis Balk at State Regulation of Teacher Training
headline.print_headline: Colorado Yogis Balk at State Regulation of Teacher Training
